did.unittitle: Indiana University Men's Faculty Club records
did.abstract: The Men's Faculty Club was established at Indiana University in 1912. The goals of the Men's Faculty Club were to organize and implement social and cultural events for members. In 1959 the group became part of a new organization called the University Club, which acted as an umbrella organization for four smaller Indiana University clubs, including the Men's Faculty Club. Starting in 1989, however, all programs organized by the four clubs have been listed under the rubric of the University Club and have been open to all members of the University Club. The collection consists of by-laws, correspondence, meeting minutes, subject files, and financial records.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The goals of the Men's Faculty Club were to organize and implement social and cultural events for members. The club was established in 1912, but was incorporated into the University Club in 1959 along with three other older Indiana University clubs, including the University Women's Club (originally titled the Faculty Women's Club when first established in 1913, renamed in 1959), the Women's Faculty Club (established in 1923), and the Newcomer's Club (originally part of the University Women's Club). From 1959 until 1988, the University Club acted as an umbrella organization for the four separate clubs it contained, with each individual club pursuing its own programs and participating University Club programs. Starting in 1989, however, all programs organized by the four separate clubs have been listed under the rubric of the University Club and have been open to all members of the University Club.

The purpose of the University Club and its affiliates was to organize and implement social and cultural events such as dinners, dances, picnics, theater and opera parties, lectures, and receptions for distinguished visitors to the campus. Membership was open to Indiana University professors, instructors, full-time lecturers, librarians, administrative officials, part-time faculty members that are not Indiana University degree candidates, visiting faculty, and spouses of members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into a single series of administrative records, including such materials as by-laws, general correspondence, meeting minutes, subject files and financial records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The first and only series in this collection consists of administrative records created by the Men's Faculty Club. The various files span the period from 1917 until 1968 and are arranged alphabetically by type of record, such as constitutions and by-laws, correspondence, financial records, membership statistics, minutes, and resignation letters.

Financial records include ledgers, receipts for membership dues, bank account statements, and expenses. The Tournament Statistics are records of a tournament held each year between members of the club, where they receive points for winning games, and they keep score much like baseball. However, the types of games that were being played are not immediately apparent, although one newspaper article found in the folder refers to men's clubs at a university playing various types of billiards.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The University Women's Club, Collection C21; the University Club, Collection C172; the Newcomer's Club, Collection C307; and the Women's Faculty Club, Collection C308.
Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: For information regarding the copyright status of this collection, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Men's Faculty Club records, Collection C306, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: This collection has been removed from the University Club records (C172).
